election_record.label: Massachusetts 1788 Governor

overview.note: "The Commonwealth, on the subject of the federal Constitution, having been thrown into two large parties previous to the election, the friends to the Constitution endeavoured to unite their suffrages in favour of federal characters; and the anti-federalist in favour of those who were opposed to the Constitution, to sustain the great offices of government the present year. His Excellency, Mr. Hancock, as Governor, and the Hon. Mr. Lincoln by some, and the Hon. Mr. Adams by others as Lieutenant Governor, were, therefore elected by the federalist; and the Hon. Gerry as Governor and the Hon. Mr. Warren, as Lieutenant Governor by the anti-federalist." The New-Hampshire Spy (Portsmouth, NH). June 3, 1788.

sub_unit.name: Provincetown
sub_unit.note: Provincetown was not listed in the Official Records.

sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Alford.
